page.title: 02FARMING AND SMALLHOLDING
page.content: This area has 37 holdings (over 40 man working days/year) which cover about 3000 hectares. The holdings consist of 14 upland, 12 dairy, 1 intensive pig farm and 10 part or spare time farms. Stock comprises 4000 cattle, 4000 sheep 800 poultry. Most of the cattle are for milk production, mostly Ayrshire cross-cemtal. Most of the poultry is for egg production. The farmers use the markets at Paisley and Kilmarnock. The main crop is barley including bere covering 63 hectares. Mixed grain, oats take up 20 hectares. Turnips, swedes and beets are sown for stock feeding. About 1000 hectares provide rough grazing and 1700 hectares are under grass which gives 81 tonnes of hay and 81 tonnes of straw gathered from the grain crops.
